titleInfo.title: Hansen et al v. Nebraska Board of Parole et al
titleInfo.subTitle: PRISONER PAYMENT ORDER granting 4 Motion for Leave to Proceed in forma pauperis; the plaintiff, Jerry L. Hansen, shall pay an initial partial filing fee of $27.85 by May 21,2007. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (copy mailed to Inga Hookstra, Accounting/Finance Manager, Nebraska Department of Correctional Services, Central Office Accounting, P.O. Box 94661, Lincoln, NE 68509-4661)(ADB)

titleInfo.title: Hansen et al v. Nebraska Board of Parole et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 5 Motion for Leave to Proceed in forma pauperis; THEREFORE, IT IS ORDERED: That filing no. 5, the plaintiffs motion to proceed IFP, is granted; That the plaintiff shall pay an initial partial filing fee of $15.46 by July 27, 2007, unless an enlargement of time is granted in response to a written motion; in the absence of the initial partial filing fee by the specified deadline, this case may be subject to dismissal; 3. That, after payment of the initial partial filing fee, the plaintiffs institution shallcollect the additional monthly payments in the manner set forth in 28 U.S.C. ยง 1915(b)(2), quoted above, and shall forward those installments to the court;That the Clerk of Court shall send a copy of this order to the appropriateofficial at the plaintiff's institution; That the plaintiff shall keep the court informed of his current address at all times, and that all parties are bound by the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure and by the courts Local Rules, while this case is pending; and That the plaintiff shall review the Notice Regarding Summons Formsattached to this Order. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett.(PCV, ) (order sent to plaintiff at address listed on the docket sheet and to institution)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 4:07-cv-03086; Hansen et al v. Nebraska Board of Parole et al;

extension.docketText: ORDER granting 5 Motion for Leave to Proceed in forma pauperis; THEREFORE, IT IS ORDERED: That filing no. 5, the plaintiffs motion to proceed IFP, is granted; That the plaintiff shall pay an initial partial filing fee of $15.46 by July 27, 2007, unless an enlargement of time is granted in response to a written motion; in the absence of the initial partial filing fee by the specified deadline, this case may be subject to dismissal; 3. That, after payment of the initial partial filing fee, the plaintiffs institution shallcollect the additional monthly payments in the manner set forth in 28 U.S.C. ยง 1915(b)(2), quoted above, and shall forward those installments to the court;That the Clerk of Court shall send a copy of this order to the appropriateofficial at the plaintiff's institution; That the plaintiff shall keep the court informed of his current address at all times, and that all parties are bound by the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure and by the courts Local Rules, while this case is pending; and That the plaintiff shall review the Notice Regarding Summons Formsattached to this Order. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett.(PCV, ) (order sent to plaintiff at address listed on the docket sheet and to institution)

titleInfo.title: Hansen et al v. Nebraska Board of Parole et al
titleInfo.subTitle: GENERAL ORDER 2007-09 concerning the management of pro se cases including supervision of pro se staff attorneys. Except for motions filed under 28 U.S.C. ยง 2255 and except for death penalty cases, Judge Kopf is assigned the overall responsibility for the management of pro se cases in the District of Nebraska and all previously filed pro se cases referred to Magistrate Judge Gossett or Magistrate Judge Thalken are herewith reassigned to Magistrate Judge Piester. The clerk's office shall file this order in each pending case referred to the Pro Se Docket in CM/ECF. Ordered by Chief Judge Bataillon. (JAE, )

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 4:07-cv-03086; Hansen et al v. Nebraska Board of Parole et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: GENERAL ORDER 2007-09 concerning the management of pro se cases including supervision of pro se staff attorneys. Except for motions filed under 28 U.S.C. ยง 2255 and except for death penalty cases, Judge Kopf is assigned the overall responsibility for the management of pro se cases in the District of Nebraska and all previously filed pro se cases referred to Magistrate Judge Gossett or Magistrate Judge Thalken are herewith reassigned to Magistrate Judge Piester. The clerk's office shall file this order in each pending case referred to the Pro Se Docket in CM/ECF. Ordered by Chief Judge Bataillon. (JAE, )

titleInfo.title: Hansen et al v. Nebraska Board of Parole et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - IT IS THEREFORE ORDERED THAT: Plaintiffs motion to extend deadline to amend petition (filing no. 13) is granted. Plaintiffs shall have until October 5, 2007 in which to amend their complaint in this matter. In the absence of Plaintiffs filing an amended complaint, this matter will proceed on the claims set forth in filing no. 1. The Clerk of the court is directed to set a pro se case management deadline with the following text: October 5, 2007: deadline for Plaintiffs to file amended complaint. Plaintiffs motion for temporary restraining order and preliminary injunction (filing no. 2) is denied without prejudice pending the amendment of the complaint.denying 2 Motion for TRO; granting 13 Motion to Extend Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon.(PCV, )(copy of order sent to plaintiffs)

titleInfo.title: Hansen et al v. Nebraska Board of Parole et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - Plaintiff Steven M. Jacob's Notice of Appeal 32, construed as a motion for interlocutory appeal, is denied. Plaintiff Steven M. Jacob's Motion for Leave to Appeal In Forma Pauperis 33 is denied as moot. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon.(Copy mailed to pro se party)(KBJ)

titleInfo.title: Hansen et al v. Nebraska Board of Parole et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - Plaintiff Jerry L. Hansen's Motions to Compel (filing nos. 56 and 64) are granted in part. Defendants shall produce the requested documents by November 28, 2008. Plaintiff Jerry L. Hansen's Motion for Subpoena (filing no. 65) and Motion for Production of Documents (filing no. 66) are denied as moot. Plaintiff Jerry L. Hansen's Fourth Motion for Extension of Time (filing no. 63) is granted. Plaintiff shall have until December 19, 2008 in which to file a response to Defendants' Motion for Summary Judgment. No further extensions of time will be permitted. The Final Pretrial Conference will be held before Magistrate Judge David L. Piester on April 2, 2009, at 9:00 a.m. The Clerk of the court is directed to set a pro se case management deadline in this case using the following text: Pretrial conference before Magistrate Judge Piester to be held on April 2, 2009. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (Copy mailed to pro se party)(TCL)

titleInfo.title: Hansen et al v. Nebraska Board of Parole et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - IT IS THEREFORE ORDERED that: Plaintiff Jerry L. Hansen's Motion for Relief from 10/29 Order (filing no. 73) is granted to the extent that the court will not consider evidence of procedures which took place during Plaintiff's November 30, 2006 hearing before the Nebraska Parole Board. Defendants' Motion for Summary Judgment (filing no. 47) is granted. A separate judgment will be entered in accordance with this Memorandum and Order. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (Copy mailed to pro se party)(TCL)
